objects.name: AI-Obfuscated SVG Phishing Campaign August 2025
objects.description: A credential phishing campaign detected in August 2025 leveraging a compromised small business email account to distribute phishing emails with an AI-obfuscated SVG attachment. The campaign used business-themed obfuscation within the SVG and redirected users to a CAPTCHA and credential harvesting page. Indicators suggest the attackers used large language models (LLMs) to generate synthetic, over-engineered code for evasion.
objects.objective: Credential theft via obfuscated SVG-based phishing payloads targeting US-based organizations.

objects.name: Obfuscated SVG Email Attachment for Credential Phishing
objects.description: Use of SVG file attachments disguised as PDF documents in phishing emails. The SVG contains invisible elements and business-related terminology to obfuscate malicious JavaScript. Scripts decode payloads from business terms, redirecting the user to a phishing site. Obfuscation is likely AI-generated.

objects.name: Obfuscated SVG JavaScript Payload
objects.description: Malicious JavaScript embedded in an SVG file. Uses business-related terms as encoded payload. Processes terms through multiple transformation steps to reconstruct malicious functionality, including redirects, browser fingerprinting, and session tracking for credential phishing. Code is likely AI/LLM-generated.

objects.name: Phishing Domain kmnl.cpfcenters.de
objects.description: Domain used to host phishing content and credential harvesting page in August 2025 SVG phishing campaign.

objects.name: Malicious SVG Attachment Filename
objects.description: Attachment filename observed in phishing campaign. Used to disguise embedded JavaScript as a PDF document.

objects.name: Mitigation of AI-Driven SVG Phishing
objects.description: Apply recommended settings for Microsoft Defender products, enable Safe Links, zero-hour auto purge (ZAP), deploy phishing-resistant authentication, increase security with Microsoft Entra, and use modern browsers with SmartScreen. Monitor for suspicious SVG attachments and related domain indicators.

objects.name: kmnl.cpfcenters.de Phishing Landing Page
objects.description: Domain hosted the landing page for CAPTCHA and credential theft, and implemented browser fingerprinting and session tracking. Served as core infrastructure for the SVG phishing campaign.
The AI-Obfuscated SVG Phishing Campaign made use of the malicious SVG file as an attachment in phishing emails.
Obfuscated SVG JavaScript Payload is embedded within the SVG file attachment.
The JavaScript malware embedded in the SVG file redirects users to the kmnl.cpfcenters.de phishing domain.
The phishing infrastructure for the campaign is hosted on kmnl.cpfcenters.de.
